Title: Mediodorsal Nucleus: Areal, Laminar, and Tangential Distribution of Afferents and Efferents in the Frontal Lobe of Rhesus Monkeys
Abstract:
"The terminal distribution of thalamic afferents in primate prefrontal cortex has never been examined in any detail. In the present study, WGA-HRP was injected into major subdivisions of the mediodorsal nucleus (MD) in the rhesus monkey in order to determine 1) The areal distribution of MD projections, 2) the layer(s) in which MD afferents terminate, 3) the tangential pattern of the MD axonal terminals, 4) the cells of origin of the reciprocal corticothalamic pathway, and 5) the degree of reciprocity between the corticothalamic and thalamocortical pathways in the different regions of the prefrontal cortex. As expected on the basis of retrograde degeneration and transport studies, injections centered in the magnocellular (MDmc) subnucleus of MD labeled cells and terminals in the ventral and medial prefrontal cortex. Injections involving ventral MDmc labeled the more lateral of these areas (Walker's areas 11 and 12); injections of the dorsal MDmc labeled the ventromedial regions (areas 13 and 14). In contrast, injections involving mainly the lateral, parvicellular (MDpc) moiety labeled cells and terminals in dorsolateral and dorsomedial areas (Walker's 46, 9, and 8B). Area 8A was labeled most prominently when injections included the multiform portion of MD (MDmf) and area 10 had connections with anterior portions of MD. A dorsal-ventral topography for MDpc exists with dorsal MDpc labeling dorsal and dorsomedial prefrontal areas and ventral MDpc labeling dorsolateral prefrontal cortex. Our findings with respect to MD are consistent with a nucleus-to-field organization of its thalamocortical projection system. Outside of the traditional boundaries of prefrontal cortex, lateral MD projections extended to the supplementary motor area (SMA) and the dorsal part of the anterior cingulate (AC) whereas the medial MD projection targeted the ventromedial cingulate cortex and spared SMA. In addition, a few labeled cells and sparse terminals were found in the inferior parietal lobule, the superior temporal sulcus, and the anterior part of the insula after injections that involved the medial part of MD. Labeled terminals were invariably confined to layer
IV and adjacent deep layer III. No terminal label was ever observed in layers I, II, superficial III, V, or VI in any part of the
cerebral cortex following injections confined to any part of MD"

@InterMapRelations.Citation: "We used Olszewski's nomenclature ('52) for the four subdivisions of the mediodorsal nucleus..."
@InterMapRelations.Comments: Because of the fact that the nomenclature of O52 is used for MD, it is assumpted that O52 is used for the nomenclature of the remaining thalamic nuclei, too.

@Injections.Citation: "In cases 8, 10, and 12R, the injections involved almost all of MD."

@LabelledSites_Descriptions.Citation: "Labeling was extensive and similar in all three cases [8, 10, 12R] and covered to different extents all of the cytoarchitectonic subdivisions of the frontal cortex."

@Injections.Citation: "In cases 1R and 11 the injections were restricted to the dorsal and lateral edge of MDpc (Fig. 8)."

@LabelledSites_Descriptions.Citation: "... The terminal labeling [in case 1R and 11] in the PFC was relative conspicuous and was found in the dorsal prefrontal cortex (area 9), the anterior portions of dorsal premotor cortex (area 6), and the dorsal ramus of the anterior arcuate sulcus (area 8A) (Fig. 8)."

@Injections.Citation: "In case 12L, the dorsolateral edge was injected so as to partly cover MDmf and MDpc."

@LabelledSites_Descriptions.Citation: "The resultant labeling was located in the dorsal PFC, mainly in the dorsal and ventral banks of the principle sulcus and the dorsomedial cortex corresponding to Walker's area 9 and 8B... the fundus of the principal sulcus was devoid of labeling."

@Injections.Citation: "In cases 8, 10, and 12R, the injections involved the almost all of MD."

@LabelledSites_Descriptions.Citation: "Labeling was extensive and similar in all three cases [8, 10, 12R] and covered to different extents all of the cytoarchitectonic subdivisions of the frontal cortex."

@Injections.Citation: "The injection in case 13 was similarly located in lateral MD, ... , involving also MDmf."

@LabelledSites_Descriptions.Citation: "... in case 13 the medial surface was very weakly labeled, and heavy label was restricted to the principal sulcus (both dorsal and ventral banks), portions of the anterior bank of the arcuate sulcus, and the lateral edge of the inferior convexity (area 12). No labeling was found outside the frontal lobe..."

@Injections.Citation: "The injection in case, although centered medial to MD, spread dorsoventrally to the MDmf."

@LabelledSites_Descriptions.Citation: "... [in case 6] the anterior bank of the superior arcuate sulcus within area 8A was heavily labeled, and area 46 contained a small amount of label."

@Injections.Citation: "...the ventrolateral edge of MD was injected in case 7, thereby involving partially the MDmf."

@LabelledSites_Descriptions.Citation: "Clusters of label were present ... mainly in the posterior bank of the inferior arcuate sulcus... as well as in the primary somatosensory area."

@Injections.Citation: "In cases 8, 10, and 12R, the injections involved the almost all of MD."

@LabelledSites_Descriptions.Citation: "Labeling was extensive and similar in all three cases [8, 10, 12R] and covered to different extents all of the cytoarchitectonic subdivisions of the frontal cortex."

@Injections.Citation: "Case 1L also had injections involving medial MD and the findings in this case were also focused, like that of case 2R, in the inferior prefrontal areas. In case 1L, the injection was more rostral and dorsal (Fig. 6) and included the anteriorally adjacent medial portion of the ventral anterior nucleus (VA) as well."

@LabelledSites_Descriptions.Citation: "... the medial orbital sulcus (Walker's area 11) and the gyrus rectus (Walker's area 14) were heavily labeled as was a portion of the medial wall corresponding to areas 9 and 25. Area 10 was largely but not fully spared (Fig. 6). No labeling was found in inferior convexity or the pricipal sulcus, with the exeption of some scattered terminals observed in the fundus."

@Injections.Citation: "In cases 1R and 11 the injections were restricted to the dorsal and lateral edge of MDpc (Fig. 8)."
@Injections.Comments: Figure 8 shows some other not clearly defined structures affected by this injection, too, which are not mentioned in the text.

@LabelledSites_Descriptions.Citation: "... The terminal labeling [in case 1R] in the PFC was relative conspicuous and was found in the dorsal prefrontal cortex (area 9), the anterior portions of dorsal premotor cortex (area 6), and the dorsal ramus of the anterior arcuate sulcus (area 8A) (Fig. 8)."

@Injections.Citation: "... case 2L in which the injection site minly labeled the dorsal or superior half of the MDpc on the left side, with very slight enchroachment, if any, of MDmf (Figs. 3, 4). There was additional involvement of the adjacent dorsal part of the central lateral nucleus but as far as MD was concerned, the medial subdivisions MDmc as well as MDdc were completely spared."

@LabelledSites_Descriptions.Citation: "In this case [case 2L], label was observed mainly in the dorsolateral PFC, extending dorsomedially from the upper lip of the entire length of the principal sulcus to the midline and over the callosal marginal gyrus to the cingulate sulcus (Walker's area 46 and 9) and subjacent cingulate gyrus (area 24)... the frontal eyefield areas (Walkers 8B and 45) were not labeled..."

"In this case [case 2L], label was observed mainly in the dorsolateral PFC, extending dorsomedially from the upper lip of the entire length of the principal sulcus to the midline and over the callosal marginal gyrus to the cingulate sulcus (Walker's area 46 and 9) and subjacent cingulate gyrus (area 24)... the frontal eyefield areas (Walkers 8B and 45) were not labeled..."

@Injections.Citation: "In this case [case 2R] the injection site involved the MDmc, its dorsal aspect primarily, and also a portion of MDdc at the level of the habenular nucleus; the injection completely spared the most ventral portion of MDmc as well as the parvicellular and multiform moieties of MD."

@LabelledSites_Descriptions.Citation: "... in case 2R, it [label] was continuous on the ventral and ventromedial surfaces, extending anteriorposteriorally from the frontal pole to the temporal pole. ...conformed to Walker's areas 10-14. In addition, selected parts of the principal sulcus were also labeled - more precisely, the fundus ... which contained cells and terminals in the rostral part..."

@Injections.Citation: "In case 3 the injection was rostral and lateral, involving the MDpc, MDmf, and to a very slight extend the medial edge of MDmc (Fig.5). In addition, the injection site crossed the anterior border of MD and labeled part of the anteromedial nucleus as well as the medial part of VAmc."
@Injections.Comments: Because of the various affected_sites the label of this injection is not entered.

@Injections.Citation: "In case 4L, the injection was similar to the cases described above in that it involved MDmf and MDpc primarily. However, it occupied a more limited area in the rostrocaudal axis. It therefore spared parts of MDmf, MDpc, and MDmc, ..."

@LabelledSites_Descriptions.Citation: "... the focus of the prefrontal labeling was similarly restricted and was most prominent in the dorsal and inferior convexity. However, ventral and ventromedial areas were practically unlabeled."

@Injections.Citation: "In case 4R ..., the WGA-HRP was in fact delivered to the area surrounding the MD, labeling marginally the most latteral part of MD. The focus of the injection was central lateral nucleus  in case 4R..."
@Injections.Comments: The labelled sites of this injection are not entered because it was not restricted to subareas of MD

"The terminal distribution of thalamic afferents in primate prefrontal cortex has never been examined in any detail.
